rev.comment: Colorado Statutes/Title 18 Criminal Code/Article 13 Miscellaneous Offenses/18-13-101. Abuse Of A Corpse.
rev.diff:
Line 3: Line 3:
In e.g. [[California]], there are laws against mutilating a corpse or digging it out of a grave, but not against having sex with it. [http://www.sfexaminer.com/article/index.cfm/i/042204n_charges]
In e.g. [[California]], there are laws against mutilating a corpse or digging it out of a grave, but not against having sex with it. [http://www.sfexaminer.com/article/index.cfm/i/042204n_charges]
â
In [[Colorado]] it might be covered by the [[misdemeanor]] "treats the body or remains of any person in a way that would outrage normal family sensibilities".
+
In [[Colorado]] it might be covered by the [[misdemeanor]] "treats the body or remains of any person in a way that would outrage normal family sensibilities". (Colorado Statutes/Title 18 Criminal Code/Article 13 Miscellaneous Offenses/18-13-101. Abuse Of A Corpse)
